#Text=Eshowe
#Text=Eshowe is the oldest town of British settlement in Zululand in South Africa and is a good base to see the Zulu culture .
#Text=The town itself is enmeshed with the Dlinza forest , one of five remaining coastal scarp forests in Kwazulu-Natal .
#Text=Understand
#Text=In 1861 , Reverend Hans Schrueder of the Norwegian Mission Society was given permission by King Mpande to start a mission station nearby .
#Text=During the Anglo-Zulu War , in 1879 , British forces occupied the mission but the fort was besieged by Zulu forces for 10 weeks .
#Text=The Zulu forces razed the fort to the ground , much as it is today near the town of Gezinsila .
#Text=Fort Nongqayi was built by the British in 1883 , and the town served as the administrative headquarters of Zululand .
#Text=The Eshowe area has been home or base at one time or another to four Zulu kings : Shaka , Mpande , Cetshwayo , and Dinizulu .
#Text=Eshowe is inland and set on an elevation , and is cooler than Durban in summer .
#Text=During the wet season , it is often misty , and is reputed to have the third highest rainfall in South Africa .
#Text=South Africa has awarded Eshowe its most picturesque town award at least once , to which a drive through its suburbs will attest .
#Text=While levels of crime affecting tourists is generally safe , caution and sensibility is advised , especially for female travellers .
#Text=By car
#Text=Drive up the N2 from Durban , turn left at the Dokodweni Plaza onto Route 66 .
#Text=Carry on straight for roughly 30 km , passing turn-offs to Gingindlovu and Mtunzini .

#Text=There are two turn-offs to Eshowe , one at the bottom of a large hill ( best to take if headed to George hotel ) and the second is at the top of the large hill , taken by turning left at the first traffic light encountered .
#Text=Ask your guesthouse which turn-off is best .
#Text=By minibus taxi
#Text=Minibus taxis leave/arrive at the main taxi rank in Eshowe .
#Text=To get to the taxi rank , follow the road that leads off Main Street between the roundabout ( outside KFC ) and the George Hotel .
#Text=Minibus taxis leave when full .
#Text=To Durban - Cost : R70 .
#Text=The dropoff in Durban is on Umgeni Road and Fynn Street , in front of Durban Station .
#Text=To Empangeni - Cost : R30 .
#Text=1 hour .
#Text=To Melmoth - Cost : R20 . 45 minutes .
#Text=By bus
#Text=The Baz Bus stops at Zululand Backpackers and the George Hotel .
#Text=The fare from Durban is R225 .
#Text=Greyhound runs bus service to Melmoth , 48.3 km from Eshowe .
#Text=You can take a minibus taxi from Melmoth to Eshowe for R20 .
#Text=Provincial public buses ( 2 a day , mornings ) also leave from the taxi rank daily .
#Text=The journey takes around 2 hours .
#Text=Get around
#Text=It is possible to walk from end to end in the Town Centre ( about 20 minutes at a medium pace ) .
#Text=The entrance to the boardwalk and visitor centre is a further 25 minute walk away from the Pick n ' Pay centre .
#Text=A car may be easier , but is not essential if you have time on your hands .
#Text=Taxis can help you visit sights you think may be too far to walk .
#Text=Eshowe Taxi Service , 116 Main Street , ☏ +2783 431-5556 . 7AM-7PM .
#Text=Meter Taxi
#Text=Service that is available for short or long distance trips .
#Text=See
#Text=Fort Nongqayi Museum , 7 Nongqayi Road , ☏ +2735 474-2281 .
#Text=M - F 7:30AM-4PM ; Weekends : 9AM-4PM .
#Text=Fort Nongqayi features the Zululand Historical museum dedicated to Zulu culture .
#Text=Also on site is Vukani Zulu Cultural Museum , Adams Outpost Restaurant , a small Chapel and a number of other NGO and community projects .
#Text=R25 .
#Text=Mpushini Falls .
#Text=A 40-minute walk from the Fort Nongqayi Museum Village .
#Text=Entumeni Nature Reserve .
#Text=Eshowe Battlefields .
#Text=Do
#Text=Walk up the one-street town centre .
#Text=Take in the feel of a market town catering to rural Zulus .

#Text=Stop at the markets and shops selling everyday necessities , such as Four Square Coleys , and Inkanyezi , buy some impepho ( a herb burnt for medicinal and spiritual purposes ) from a street trader outside OK Bazaars .
#Text=Zulu Village Tours and Events .
#Text=The George Hotel organizes guided tours of the Zulu villages and arranges attendance at Zulu weddings , Sangoma healing ceremonies , and coming of age ceremonies .
#Text=half day tour : R350 , full day tour : R495 .
#Text=Shakaland ( Drive on the R66 out toward Melmoth for about 20 minutes , signposted ) .
#Text="

#Text=Guests stay in traditional beehive huts and day visitors can dine at the restaurant overlooking lake Phobane , and pick up curios at their well-stocked Curio Shop .
